website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Mirage 4 is a road running shoe that is designed for neutral foot movement. It is light and fast perfect for high mileage runs and competition.
pros: The shoe has great cushioning according to some reviews
The upper is light and breathable
The shoe provides a good and comfortable fit
Many runners mentioned that the Mirage 4 is a fast shoe perfect for competition
cons: The shoe is heavier than the previous version
Some runners noticed that the outer materials of the shoe wear off quickly
It was also noted in some reviews that the shoe is a lot stiffer than the usual

customer_reviews.title: The Best Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these a total of 3 times!! Awesome shoes. These converted me from being an Asics runner to a Saucony runner. Comfortable, durable, true-to-size, these running shoes are lightweight without sacrificing comfort/padding. The sole is soft and offers great support. These can take 400-500 miles before needing to be replaced, though the outer fabric may look worn before that time comes. Very satisfied with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: jjheartblogTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for forefoot, mid foot runners with a little support
customer_reviews.text: My go-to shoe for running. Moderate support shoe with low rise heal, ideal for forefoot or mid foot runners looking for a bit of support against over pronation. I switched to this shoe after running barefoot or minimal for a few years. My ankle prefers the pronation support. The foam midsole is not over cushioned, which I prefer. It is stable and gives good ground feel. Low rise allows more of a natural forefoot or mid foot strike. Only drawback to these shoes is the minimal approach to rubber on the tread tends to limit their lifespan, but on the other hand they are very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: meep

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Light
customer_reviews.text: This shoe looks better in person than in the picture. They are light, weighing in at 10 oz. (size 11). Heel to toe offset is 4mm, and there is good arch support from the removable footbed. Ample padding lines the collar and tongue. I would rate the flexibility as slightly below average, but it presented no problem in comfort level. If you are a runner, which, at this age I am not, you will be happy with the cushioning and stability of the Mirage 4. The sole appears to be fabricated of durable materials. Lacing is standard with "throwback" flat laces. Al-in-all, definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonalex

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it's the first running shoe with which my feet can fall asleep while running. I have no idea why that happens. Other than that, comfortable shoe. As always with Saucony I suspect the area around the pinky toe will give in pretty quickly, which is why I labeled them as "somewhat narrow." I am very surprised with the comfort of this shoe overall and would get it again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald in Denver

customer_reviews.title: I have a narrow foot and these feel like they should serve me well
customer_reviews.text: Narrow foot. 6' 200lbs and I run 10-15mi a week for some cardio. Also play tennis 3x week. Switched to these from the Progrid Mirage. These are a bit lighter with a touch less overall support. Plenty of mid-foot support. The toe-box is a little roomy but not too much. I have a narrow foot and these feel like they should serve me well. I doubt they'll last as long for me as the Mirage 2 did - a year and a half. I will use them until I can no more and probably go back to the Mirage 2 if I can find them.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Like the shoe, but...
customer_reviews.text: I would give it five stars but had to return it because the material near the pinkie toe sags down when stepping. The sagging material then hits my pinky toe. It happened on both shoes but it only hit my toe on the right shoe. I’ve I only tried one pair but it seems like it might be a design flaw because it happened on both shoes.
customer_reviews.author: aps

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for recreational running/walking a few miles a day.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: All Day Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Saucony is my favorite running shoe brand and as expected they feel extremely comfortable. I am able to wear these all day and my feet don't hurt hardly at all like many of my other shoes. they fit perfectly and I really like they way they look. I don't think I will ever buy another brand of running shoe these are definitely my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Good trainers for first-time marathon runners
customer_reviews.text: I really recommend these shoes to intermediate runners. I've been training for my first marathon and I can honestly say these shoes are great for marathon beginners! They had a great bounce at first, although I must admit I am a somewhat small guy (5ft 7in, 142lbs). My only complaint is that I only got about 485 miles out of these between March 15 to August 20. They are also true to size, and I really liked the colors and style. I'm going to try The North Face Ultra Smooth now. If they don't perform well, I'll certainly go back to these.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: The last three pairs of running shoes I have bought have been Saucony, I love the way they fit and the way they make my feet feel. Great support and cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoes
customer_reviews.text: This shoes arrive to Hawai'i in a week, and it looks and perform as I expected after I'd wearing it the 1st time and 8 miles later. The shoe is a little tight on the width in the beginning and had loosen up a little bit after the 5th miles...I'd order 8.5M which is what I normally wear as my feet are somewhat flat with little arch. Over All it is a very good running shoes and great under foot support and fast striking...this is my 1st Saucony Running shoes that I own and I'll see how well it will hold up after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Hawai'i Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good feel to them and light weight material makes them ...
customer_reviews.text: Use these for everyday use and for trail running mostly. Good feel to them and light weight material makes them a first pick for comfort, and the durability holds up pretty well in rugged terrain (minor aesthetic issue though with the silver accent fabric frying almost immediately if your feet rub together at all - does not affect overall durability though)
customer_reviews.author: Mauk

customer_reviews.title: More narrow than Breakthru 2
customer_reviews.text: These would be a perfect shoe if i coukd get them in a wide width. Breakthfu 2 fit perfect. These run more narrow in the toe box
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyday Shoes
customer_reviews.text: First ACTUAL pair of running shoes I have purchased and used after years of swearing by Nike Free Run shoes. These shoes are comfortable, affordable, and great for everyday use. My only dislike and complaint is that I after running a total of about 10 miles (max) in a week, the stitching on the outside started to come undone. Not sure how normal this kind of wear is, especially since I am a major Over-pronator, but it just seemed too early for that to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Review from a mirage 3 wearer.
customer_reviews.text: The mirage 4 is very stiff and unresponsive. I am a lighter weight runner who needs a little arch support but likes a more flexible and responsive shoe. This is the first shoe I felt like I had to fight to get it to do want I wanted. I am a midfoot striker with a fast pace and after two miles I couldn't take it anymore. These are going back. If you like a stiff shoe with some arch support these are a good choice otherwise look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: ANON

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my husband to replace his last pair ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband to replace his last pair. Fits the same (true to size, very comfortable) and he LOVES running in them. He's a front-foot striking runner and finds that these provide the right amount of support while still being lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable (and very welcome) design updates!
customer_reviews.text: The husband loves Saucony shoes but has been notorious for wearing them out quickly. The Mirage 4 has a better reinforcement between the toe bumper and the top mesh which is where he stresses shoes the most. Great light-weight comfortable running shoe and (hopefully) built to last!
customer_reviews.author: Lotta Tunes

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable. I did buy a half size larger than ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these for a couple of weeks including running two 5ks but, so far, they are comfortable. I did buy a half size larger than normal because your feet swell after running for a couple of miles.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: Have worn Saucony #4s for the past five years, they are excellent for my feet. The company is phenomenal, great for defective product and never give the customer the run around. The shoes wear for a long long time and then become biking shoes, beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... tried every once of this series and I have loved them all
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every once of this series and I have loved them all, except this one. While I do like it, it does not fit and fell the same as the ones before it. It is a little stiffer and for me has a little more support than before.
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Not what I'd expect from a Mirage.
customer_reviews.text: Too firm and not forgiving. For the firmness, these should not be worn for more than a 10 k as there are a lot of shoes out where that are plush and responsive. The shoes are not as responsive as billed either. Very disappointed with this edition.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for Fathers' Day. He LOVES them. He walks a lot and they are cushy and feel great. I've been wearing Saucony for 15 years and I have my first convert!
customer_reviews.author: Lyla Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Best I've had yet
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes. I wear them nearly everyday with no problems. I have high arches and these provide plenty of support and the heel to toe drop is perfect. I have been wearing these for about 6 months with no signs of them ripping out.
customer_reviews.author: Evan G

customer_reviews.title: Slightly smaller than the older version but not so much that it empedes my training.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are slightly smaller that the previous versions but it hasn't impacted my training since I don't run nearly as often as I used to. If I were to start training for another half or full marathon I would get a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mustad

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Switched from New Balance to these after reading good reviews. Been running 3-4 miles twice and they felt good.
customer_reviews.author: dc9den

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe...I have yet to be disappointed with Saucony footwear for the amount of running I do (roughly 15-20 miles running a week).
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie Higgins

customer_reviews.title: These don't last I wouldn't buy them again
customer_reviews.text: The fit is good and cushioning seems to work but the surface stitching begin to break after just a few days and they look like this.
customer_reviews.author: Celina A.

customer_reviews.title: great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Saucony mirage 4 running shoes are my favorite. They are very light and gives good support. I'm buying another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sperry

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe if you want a modest heal to toe drop, a bit of support and a wide toes box with nice forefoot cushioning. They feel light to run in too for a shoe like this.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of the same shoe. I like them a lot. However the sizing is on the small side.I usually wear size 7 and in this particular shoe I wear a size 8.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker for distance running
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable sneakers for distance running. Wish I could find them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe - hope you don't ever discontinue it! My teenage son runs track & cross country and he loves this shoe. Great cushion and just the riight stability (not too much/ not too little.) this shoe is also very lightweight - good for a distance runner.
customer_reviews.author: sandiegoallday

customer_reviews.title: No painful arch like Nike
customer_reviews.text: Note on the arch support. I have somewhat flat wide feet so these shoes accommodate me in that aspect. No painful arch like Nike. Love running in them
customer_reviews.author: Wettek

customer_reviews.title: many miles on his previous pair of Saucony Mirage 4's and he is very happy with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband logged many, many miles on his previous pair of Saucony Mirage 4's and he is very happy with these shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: ciclodiva

customer_reviews.title: Fit great, although they're a little stiff at first will ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, although they're a little stiff at first will take several times running in them before they're broken it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These have great toebox space, low drop and good neutral pronation support.
customer_reviews.author: Silver

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of workout shoes I have had in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of workout shoes I have had in a long time. They fit well and provides good comfort. I will purchase another pair in a different color. I recommend this sport shoe.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: these are my shoes of choice, run 10Km a day and no leg injury
customer_reviews.author: alias

customer_reviews.title: been wearing them for miles and miles. used them ...
customer_reviews.text: been wearing them for miles and miles. used them for the LA Marathon in March 2015. never had knee issue anymore after using these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Franchomme

customer_reviews.title: ... shoes to workout in and so far they are great. The sole has a nice cushion and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to workout in and so far they are great. The sole has a nice cushion and I would recommend these to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Son of Greer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great shoes for running. neutral running shoe with good arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Poseidon

customer_reviews.title: Loyal fan
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the Mirage for years...good support in a lightweight shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Chief H

customer_reviews.title: but sturdy. Great selection of models and colors
customer_reviews.text: Very light, but sturdy. Great selection of models and colors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Tight shoe great service
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the shoe ebb because it wasn't wide enough but the seller was phenomenal
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Comfortable. Eased my leg pain. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robin W. Coffey

customer_reviews.title: just not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Runs a bit narrow. Decent shoe, just not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, look for the 5 though
customer_reviews.text: I'm really, really upset Saucony is discontinuing the Mirage series after the Mirage 5. Excellent shoes on both roads and dry trails.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Smith

customer_reviews.title: I have been wearing Saucony Mirage's since Mirage 2 and I have loved every one
customer_reviews.text: I have run twice so far in these shoes for a total of 10 miles. I have been wearing Saucony Mirage's since Mirage 2 and I have loved every one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W. Landucci

customer_reviews.title: I've just started breaking them in. I have stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: I've just started breaking them in. I have stuck with the Mirage line for the strong arch support. This is my 4th pair.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have a half marathon run in Oakland ca this coming Saturday. I will find out, just how durable and comfortable these SAUCONY'S really are. 🏃🏃🏃🏃🏃🏃🏃🏃🏃
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: They are great shoes otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Was too narrow for my feet... Maybe i just have wide feet, but i simply cant wear them. They are great shoes otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: TED

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: This my second pair of these shoes. They are great and I have increased my pace since I switch from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mays

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and nice and bouncy
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Light weight. Nice and bouncy. Have put about thirty miles the first week on them and am quote happy. I will likely get another pair in prep for the spring marathon season.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G.

customer_reviews.title: No break in required.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Reasonably light and can run right out of the box. No break in period required.
customer_reviews.author: LikePrime

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great, only that its an old model so to expensive.
customer_reviews.author: julie c. medina

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes. I have put over 600 miles on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoes. I have put over 600 miles on these. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: George Moore

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It was the right fit as expected. It arrived on time and in brand new shape. Completely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: George Appiah-Pipim

customer_reviews.title: Nice and fast but a bit large
customer_reviews.text: My favorite 10k shoe. But the toe box has expanded and the nice slick fit is no more. A shame because I would love to give this shoe a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Eriksson

customer_reviews.title: and because of these reviews i got a nice new shoe
customer_reviews.text: They are as i expected, and because of these reviews i got a nice new shoe.
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: Mirage 4
customer_reviews.text: Ran a mini marathon in these over the last weekend. They are very supportive and have a nice cushioned ride.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Like a Kinvara
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time Kinvara fan, but wanted something with a little more support. These fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Silverberg

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice ride, run 20 25 miles per week on asphalt, good support
customer_reviews.author: Dean Maytag

customer_reviews.title: Not the right shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: They were to big and the bottoms wore out to fast
customer_reviews.author: FizFam

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is fantastic. Shoe reviews are difficult because shoes fit people differently. For me, I like this shoe a lot. I would only suggest breaking in the shoe with plenty of walking or light jogging before commencing an intense training regiment. That should go without being said.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for me
customer_reviews.text: My foot is a little wide and this shoe fits me perfectly. Also has minimal front to back rise. Third pair I've owned. The mesh does wear faster than I would want but worth it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Fryer III

customer_reviews.title: 1st Time On-line Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery - I've worn Saucony 11.5 shoes for over a year and they fit fine. These shoes were slightly tighter than expected, especially on the arch and outside base of the big toe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were larger than my average 10 1/2. I ...
customer_reviews.text: These were larger than my average 10 1/2. I would've sized down a half-size had I known, it has a largr toebox too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas V Bronga

customer_reviews.title: Too bad that this shoe has been discontinued and not replaced ...
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these for years, so I knew to size up a half size, but I do these for most running shoes. Too bad that this shoe has been discontinued and not replaced with something similar,
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J. Kirkner

customer_reviews.title: Great for Me
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to find a pair of running shoes that I absolutely love. These are about as close as it gets. They are very light but provide good stable support for me. Running shoes are really a personal preference and for me they are great.
customer_reviews.author: KKORN

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good paIr of running shoes, although like Hoka shoes better.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Still a great shoe with moderate pronation correction/support
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that these run on the narrow side. Sizing seems about a half size smaller than my older Mirage 2's. Still a great shoe with moderate pronation correction/support.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Silver

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: I have worn New Balances for years. This was the first pair of Saucony shoes. They won't be my last. Most comfortable shoes ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Lee Allen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and they are great for walking and running.
customer_reviews.author: Rusudan Gogoberidze

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These booties gave me planta-fascia withnot enough padding on the heal They also fell apart
customer_reviews.author: Tony Clemente

customer_reviews.title: New model is not an improvement
customer_reviews.text: I have run on Mirage 2 and 3 fro several years. These mirage 4 are noticeably narrower. Plus shoelaces are different lengths.
customer_reviews.author: KMmusiclover

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nike
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Run 4 miles a day. Switched from nikes. Second pair. So happy!
customer_reviews.author: L. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Fit and feel great! They lace up nice and even with no room for shifting! Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Lane

product_meta.title: Saucony Mens Men's Mirage 4-M Mirage 4
product_meta.description: Saucony delivers lightweight responsiveness with this update to their Mirage line.
feature_bullets: Lightweight runner featuring sleek no-sew upper and reflective logos
